benchmark_details.name: January Food Benchmark (JFB)
benchmark_details.overview: The January Food Benchmark (JFB) is a publicly available dataset consisting of 1,000 food images with human-validated annotations for meal names, ingredients, and macronutrients, designed to facilitate automated nutritional analysis and improve evaluation methodologies in AI.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a high-quality, publicly available dataset for benchmarking and evaluating models in automated food analysis.

data.source: Sourced from users of a mobile health application who consented to data use for research, featuring real-world images logged by users.
data.annotation: Human validation and correction for all annotations including meal name, ingredients, quantities, and macronutrients.

methodology.calculation: Overall Score is calculated using a weighted geometric mean of performance metrics reflecting the application-oriented needs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better model performance across the assessed metrics.
methodology.baseline_results: january/food-vision-v1 achieved an Overall Score of 86.2.
methodology.validation: Rigorous, multi-stage validation process ensures high-quality annotations.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All images were collected with informed consent, and identifying information was removed.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Released under a CC-BY-4.0 license to encourage reproducibility and downstream research.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Users consented to data use for research as part of the mobile app's Terms of Service.
